item.title: Auto-Scope - Stage Driver V1
item.dc:creator: Wytamma
item.description:
It only took all of Saturday, but I finshed the stage driver protoype for our progamable mircoscope project: Auto-Scope.

The design is pretty simple; there are two mounting points on stage that I chose to use to support the unit. The unit is designed to be modular for easy printing and upgrading. I had to print a few parts along the way while I iterated on the design, but it's now looking pretty good. The final design is currently printing on my CR-10 and will hopefully come out as depicted above. Once it's assembled the real fun (aka the Python) can start!

UPDATE: 19/8/18

The print has finished, and I've assembled the stage driver unit onto my OMAX microscope (see below). Overall I'm happy with the design. However, there are a few changes I'd like to make in V2.

  • The text on the top of the unit didn't work, possibly because the top section is printed upsidedown?
  • I accounted for a 0.1mm gap in the joint design; however it did require some sanding to get them fitting nicely.
  • Although the assembled unit is small, it's not small enough. Currently, you have to remove the microscope base to attach it.
  • Lots of screws...
If you're interested in looking at my design in person come to next Mondays python-friends meetup, we'll be trying to get this thing to move!
